abstract: Bank of America, seeking to overturn a decision that halted its $21 billion acquisition of the LaSalle Bank, is expected to claim that a Dutch commercial court acted in a “shocking” and unlawful manner in freezing the transaction, The Financial Times reported, citing a copy of the appeal filing the newspaper obtained. The sale of LaSalle has emerged as a key element in the larger takeover battle for the Dutch bank ABN Amro.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America, seeking to overturn a decision that halted its $21 billion acquisition of the LaSalle Bank, is expected to claim that a Dutch commercial court acted in a “shocking” and unlawful manner in freezing the transaction, The Financial Times reported, citing a copy of the appeal filing the newspaper obtained. The sale of LaSalle has emerged as a key element in the larger takeover battle for the Dutch bank ABN Amro.

headline.main: Bank of America Said to Appeal Ruling on LaSalle Deal
